The Significant Other At one point or another in everyones lives, we will have what I will call "The Significant Other". One of those few people you date, who becomes so much a part of your life, that going to the washroom seems like a trip to Siberia, without them. Whether you are straight, gay or whomever....this person will play a key role in your life. It is with this comment that I address those people who, (maybe subconciously), literally pack up their previous life (ie; life before "The One"), and store it in a box, in some grimy hole of their mind. It IS TRUE!! I have personally witnessed people; forget friends names!, leave their homes, and yes!! YES even toss beloved pets aside, all for the love of well.......love. To those who are finding this sounds a little too familiar, be you the "dating" or the "dumped", I say this: To the "dating"; Wake up. If there is ever a time you need your friends, it is always. To the "dumped friend" Ok, so now that you know who your friends are, go out and find some better ones.

Well Blog Friends, My time in Windsor is coming to an end. I will be moving on to new and exciting things soon. This post is a wonderous recap of my life in Windsor. 1999-*FIRST YEAR* I arrive at my new home in Windsor, Ontario. MacDonald Hall, room 814. I discover that my roomate was actually born in the same hospital as I was, exactly one month apart. The closet we share (by closet I mean tiny room) is by no means luxurious, but we make it livable with pictures from home and fun posters. Jill Lewis and I shared a rollercoaster year in residence, where strangely enough people do NOT act like adults, even though they are all over 12, and attending University. 2000-2001-*SECOND YEAR* I have moved into a wonderfully old house with slanted roofs and fun little closets in the hallways. My self, Laura Barr, Stephanie Hilliard, Richard Brunner,and Luke Jaster, have agreed to share liiving quarters (cause that was really the extent of the relationship) We had a really great Halloween party. Some guy got naked in our basement, and scrubbed up in the extra shower down there, in front of a large group of girls. We had some rough times, mostly due to the fact that some of us had a different view on what cleanlyness and paying the rent means. (Some actually believe COCKROACHES are a sign of cleanliness. Go figure) I will mostly remember the alcoholic rampage that went down in a certain boys room......R......I.....you get it. Jamaal Grant set the land speed record for coming to a girls aid in 2.4 seconds from 20 blocks away, when she hasn't even put the phone down, after screaming at him to "GET OVER HERE!! HE'S GONE COMPLETELY NUTS!!!!!!" But I digress. I loved that little house and I will never forget it. 2001-2002-*THIRD YEAR* Needing some sanity, I move in with longtime schoolchum Sara Wisking. She was accepted to Law School at Windsor, and we hurriedly found an apartement in AUGUST. Needless to say it was a long walk to school. I had a great year. I worked at the University Players Box Office once again, and had fun working part-time for TD Canada Trust. Most Memorable was the flood of 2002. Sara and I lived in a variable swimming pool for 4 days, when the upstairs neighbours pipes burst in their kitchen. The upstairs neighbour was very nice to us. She made us tea when we had no power.!! No heat, no power, new kitty. Not fun!!! Needless to say, the bottom floor of an apartement building is not the greatest. 2002-2003-*FOURTH YEAR* WELL!!! My last year here. Moved to a new apartement with Sara, closer to school WHICH WAS GREAT!!! Sara met a nice boy named Scott. He is a pilot. He helped us shlep all our stuff over to the new apt, when our GIMPY Dads couldn't make it. They are both invalids!! I had some fun times. Found out about life and what's at the end of the rainbow. No boys to speak of. But I DON'T CARE!!! I am employed at a cool summer camp starting in June. I AM SO EXCITED!!! I can't wait to go home to Ottawa, and see my BEST FRIEND KARIN SELST!!!! She is just finishing her Masters Degree. Smart Gal that Karin. When I get back from camp I plan to take some required courses for health sciences, and get into Med school, or first Nursing. Not sure, but I am enjoying this new direction in my life. LOVE TO ALL!! Hope you keep checking up on me as I'll be posting from around North America this coming summer!!!!!! GOD BLESS!!! TAKE CARE!!! BE NICE TO ANIMALS!!! LOVE ALWAYS ALLISON
